data.question: In which of the following PMBOK Guide processes would you determine the quality standards that are relevant to the project and how the project will satisfy them?
data.explanation: The purpose of the plan quality process is to determine which quality standards are applicable for the project and how the team intends to meet them.

data.question: Which of the following statements about quality is NOT true?
data.explanation: Quality may not be inspected in. Inspection only occurs after the product or service is created, and therefore cannot change the level of quality for the already produced product or service.

data.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true concerning the scope statement?
items: The scope statement contains key inputs to the Quality Plan
The scope statement is crafted in the Project Scope Management process
The scope statement defines important stakeholder requirements
None; all of the above are true
data.explanation: The scope statement is a critical document for the development of the quality management plan. It is important because it defines important stakeholder requirements.

data.question: Which of the following must be considered when defining the quality plan?
items: All of the above must be considered
data.explanation: Many different factors must be considered when defining the quality plan. Factors such as the major stakeholder requirements, environmental factors, company culture, and industry standards all must be included.

data.question: When considering the product description which of the following is NOT true?
items: It is developed during Project Scope Management processes
It contains details that may affect quality planning
It will be redefined during quality assurance
data.explanation: Once defined, the product description should not be redefined except under extreme conditions and only when approved by the sponsor.

data.question: Which of the following statements concerning benchmarking is NOT true?
items: Benchmarking may be used for process and product improvement
Benchmarking can produce Type II errors for organizational validation
Benchmarking can be done within the organization or with other organizations that have similar processes
Benchmarking can disrupt a project if improperly done
data.explanation: A type II error occurs when the customer rejects a good lot. This has nothing to do with benchmarking.

data.question: Which of the following is NOT a synonym for a type of diagram used to evaluate areas of concern and their potential causes?
data.explanation: Cause and effect, Ishikawa, and fishbone are all names for a diagram used to evaluate potential problems and their causes.

data.question: Which of the following statements is true about process diagrams?
items: Process diagrams may be used to identify potential problem areas
Process diagrams may be used in process improvement
Both of the above are true
None of the above are true
data.explanation: Process diagrams may be used to identify potential problems, and used in process improvements.

data.question: Which of the following statements concerning DOE is NOT true?
items: DOE was made popular by Taguchi
DOE provides a statistical framework for systematically changing all of the important factors, instead of changing factors one at a time
DOE analysis does not provide optimal conditions for the product or process
None; all of the above are true
data.explanation: Design of Experiments, or DOE, creates a way of analyzing multiple variables on a project as defined by Taguchi.

data.question: A good quality assurance plan will address all of the following EXCEPT:
data.explanation: A good quality assurance plan will address processes and procedures, quality assurance, control, and improvement, and define resources needed to implement the plan.

data.question: Which of the following plans is NOT included in the quality assurance plan?
data.explanation: There are many plans that might be part of the quality assurance plan, but the infrastructure assessment plan is not one of them.

data.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true of a good quality assurance system?
data.explanation: A good quality assurance system has nothing to do with correction. A good quality assurance system is prevention oriented.
